chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: Seam extends the CDI programming model into the messaging world by allowing you to inject JMS resources into your beans. Further, Seam bridges the CDI event bus over JMS; this gives you the benefits of CDI-style type-safety for inter-application communication.

section.title: Mission statement
section.para: The JMS module for Seam 3 is to provide injection of JMS resources and the necessary scaffolding for a bidirectional propagation of CDI event over JMS.

section.title: Seam 3 JMS Module Overview
section.para: The general goals can be divided into two categories: injection of JMS resources and bridging of events:

itemizedlist.title: Event Bridge
itemizedlist.listitem: Inbound: Routes CDI events to JMS destinations
Outbound: Fires CDI events based on the reception of JMS messages
